item.name: D-Day Dice
item.wishlistcomment: 1-4 players, 30 minutes don't care much for the theme - game sounds nice, though Coming March 2012 - kickstarter -

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment:
3-5 players, 100 minutes surviving with your own interests another try at the coop-yet-selfish concept. The designer are aware of the problem and have adressed it... I really hope it flies this time :) sounds cool
##Edit now I've played it: This is really cool and for me the semi-coop works really well, even though it always leads to interesting discussions afterwards - but that only makes it more interesting IMHO :)

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment: Very unbalanced at times. Makes it no fun for the "weaker" side to play without a real chance.

item.name: Di Renjie
item.comment: with the kickstarter promo materials: foldable origami card holders and promo card

item.name: Die Alchemisten
item.comment: Won in contest....I am excited to finally get this :D

item.name: Diplomacy
item.comment: I like the aspect of the game that there is no actual luck involved, but only manipulative skills, subterfuge, etc.

item.name: Dominion: Alchemy
item.wishlistcomment:
PROS: More Dominion goodness!!
CONS: maybe when I see the cards, but short of being broken, I can't see anything bad coming around.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Firefly: The Game
item.wishlistcomment: 4 players, 120 minutes doesn't look too promising - the map is a bit stale and everyone "just" having the same Firefly-class ship is a bit one-sided - let's see what the game has to offer gameplay-wise.

item.name: Formica
item.comment: the pure fun, if you're not shying away from playing silly games :) - a bit like enhanced Ludo/Pachisi, but lots more fun.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
Hellas
item.comment: Played it once and got into a loop, where no player could win the game - EVER if no mistakes were made!

item.name: Im Wandel der Zeiten: Eine Geschichte der Zivilisation
item.originalname: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.wishlistcomment: 2-4 players, 240 minutes too long and maybe too "dry"

item.name: Imperial
item.wishlistcomment: I cannot really decide between Imperial (which I played and like a lot) and Imperial 2030, but I think, since it would be a new experience, I tend towards 2030 a bit.

item.name: Innovation
item.wishlistcomment: 2-4 players, 30 minutes waiting for the "nice" GERMAN version with better graphics or getting the english Asmadi edition because of the available expansion(s) 20‚Ç¨

item.name: Mage Wars Arena
item.wishlistcomment: 2-6 players, 90 minutes customizable with spellbooks german edition

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.wishlistcomment: 1-4 players, 60 minutes coop mice playing game :) waiting for the german version - 10 / 2013

item.name: Mistfall
item.wishlistcomment:
1-4 players, coop.
Heroes on their quest to destroy evil :) Every player with their own personal deck and cards to level up the hero during the game (and with the add-on even campaigns are possible).
Cool deck manipulation mechanics: played cards often go under the deck or on the deck and can be redrawn or stacked for future turns. Except for the first setup, the deck is not shuffled again, so a lot depends on your tactics.

item.name: Polarity
item.wishlistcomment:
PROS: Cool bits and gameplay
CONS: dexterity game - will probably not see much play

item.name: Project: ELITE
item.comment: Despite the miniatures issue, this is a really fun game!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Robinson Crusoe: Abenteuer auf der verfluchten Insel
item.originalname: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment:
I've played it several times and with different players. Almost all of the other players were frustrated with the way how brutal the game can be without you having a chance and werent very eager to play another round.
The theme never really shone in our games, so what remained was a luck-driven cube/token pusher.
And after some games where I really wanted to like the game, it really starts to rub off on me....
The solo game is still okay, though.
item.wishlistcomment: ***Essen 2012*** *1-5 players, 120 minutes *coop, where every player is for himself, *but every action influences the others and the outcome. *Sounds promising

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
item.wishlistcomment: the kickstarter is a bit too expensive with the shipping, this time. Wait for the normal release

Target Earth

item.name: Tick... Tack... Bumm!
item.comment: We always have a very good time, playing this game and since it fits in nicely into the last half or quarter hour of a playing evening, we will surely play it quite often.

item.name: War of the Ring Collector's Edition
WARS Trading Card Game
item.comment: If one wants to play a complex game and does not shy away from playing a trading card game - this should be the game of choice!
